highlights: Ran tests on hundreds of different Math problems from problem sets ranging from Basic Math to Algebra and Geometry
Used Jira Kanban to claim, clear and report bugs on Math problems

project.name: BlueTube
project.summary: Video hosting website inspired by YouTube
highlights: Leveraved polymorphic associations on the Likes table with comments and videos, allowing for DRY code and efficient database calls
Used AJAX and Ruby on Rails to implement CRUD actions on videos, comments, and likes.
Stored videos and thumbnails on Amazon Web Services S3 (AWS S3) for increased uploading speed as well as scalability of media storage.
Validated user sign in with hashed and salted passwords using BCRYPT as well as session tokens generated with SecureRandom and stored in cookies

project.name: KRMA
project.summary: Media exchange platform, allowing users to inspire others through image and video posts
highlights: Coordinated with teammates using Git workflow, allowing for simultaneous, collaborative development
Used validators to handle error rendering for session forms, ensuring user security and privacy

project.name: TileDoge
project.summary: Typing game on an 8x8 tile grid with adversaries and obstacles
